bibl.title: Letter from L. O. Howard to Walter Reed, January 10, 1901

div1.p: Howard informs Reed that Woldert recommends using kerosene to eradicate mosquitoes, and includes a postscript regarding the genus of the yellow fever mosquito. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Letter from L. O. Howard to Walter Reed, January 10, 1901
div1.p:
Dr. Woldert, of Philadelphia, to whom I wrote you
the other day, writes again to tell me that in his experience in-
stead of pouring kerosene on mosquito breeding pools it is better
to use a mop or a broom, as it spreads better, and is more economical.
That is the method advised by the English experimenters in Sierra
Leone. I have never tried it, but hope to do so in the spring.
Some of your people will have a chance to try it sooner.
div1.closer:
Hoping you are well,
Sincerely yours, L.O. Howard Dr. Walter Reed,
Columbia Barracks,
Havana, Cuba.
P.S. There is little
doubt now that Culex fasciatus & C.
Teniatus are identical. Theobald separates teniatus
from culex & makes a new genus of it - Stegomyia
THE NATIONAL ARCHIVES OF THE UNITED STATES
LITTERA
SCRIPTA
MANET
* 1934 *
THE NATIONAL ARCHIVES
Washington, D. C.
RECORDS OF THE DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE, Bureau of
